result.execSummary:
The defendant Willy J Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Petitioner appeared, pro se.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Kelly O'Neill.
Deputy Court Clerk: bvj
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and petitioner.  Court denies petition with prejudice.
Return of property hearing on November 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willy J Love in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Allysa Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ONE DAY time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
AODA/RANDOM URINE SCREENS/TREATMENT
*10 DAYS CONDITION TIME TO BE USED AT AGENT DISCRETION FOR ANY  POSITIVE DRUG TESTS
*COMPLETE A PARENTING CLASS
*MAY NOT POSSESS ANY FIREARMS
*PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES DURING PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
*

Defendant Willy J Love in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willy J Love in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willy J Love in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/29/15 @ 1:30 pm
